de.lambeck.pned.models.data

Class DataModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lambeck.pned.models.data.DataModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDataModel, IModelRename, IModel

    public class DataModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDataModel, IModelRename
    Implements the data model (for 1 Petri net).
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static boolean debug
      Show debug messages?
      private java.lang.String displayName
      This should be the name of the tab.
      private java.util.List<IDataElement> elements
      List of all elements in this model
      private boolean initialModelCheck
      Will be set to false as soon as "modelChecked" is set to true for the first time.
      private boolean modelChecked
      Will be set to false any time the model will be changed/modified Will be set to true after the model has been validated to true or false
      private boolean modelModified
      This attribute is set if the model was modified in any way to make sure that the user is asked for "file save" when closing the file.
      private java.lang.String modelName
      This should be the canonical (unique) path name of the file.
      private boolean modelValid
      Will be set to true if the model is valid other wise to false

      • debug

        private static boolean debug
        Show debug messages?

      • modelName

        private java.lang.String modelName
        This should be the canonical (unique) path name of the file.

      • displayName

        private java.lang.String displayName
        This should be the name of the tab. (file name only)

      • elements

        private java.util.List<IDataElement> elements
        List of all elements in this model

      • modelModified

        private boolean modelModified
        This attribute is set if the model was modified in any way to make sure that the user is asked for "file save" when closing the file.

      • modelChecked

        private boolean modelChecked
        Will be set to false any time the model will be changed/modified Will be set to true after the model has been validated to true or false

      • initialModelCheck

        private boolean initialModelCheck
        Will be set to false as soon as "modelChecked" is set to true for the first time.

      • modelValid

        private boolean modelValid
        Will be set to true if the model is valid other wise to false

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataModel

        public DataModel(java.lang.String modelName,
                 java.lang.String displayName)
        Constructs the date model with a specified name.

        Intended use: name == path of the PNML file
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        displayName - The name of the tab (the file name only)

      • setModelName

        public void setModelName(java.lang.String s)
        Description copied from interface: IModelRename
        Sets the name of this model. (Use this method to rename this model in case the user has saved the model under a new file name.)

        Note: This is in a non-public interface because the model controller has to keep his list of models up to date!
        Specified by:
        setModelName in interface IModelRename
        Parameters:
        s - The new full name

      • isModified

        public boolean isModified()
        Description copied from interface: IModel
        Returns true if this model has been modified, otherwise false.

      • isInitialModelCheck

        public boolean isInitialModelCheck()
        Description copied from interface: IDataModel
        This function indicates whether the next validation of this model is the initial validation after reading from a PNML file.

        Note: This function is necessary for the InitialMarkingValidator to allow to decide whether to reset the marking or not.
        Specified by:
        isInitialModelCheck in interface IDataModel
        Returns:
        true = model was never checked before, false = model already was checked before

      • setModified

        public void setModified(boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: IModel
        Sets the "modified" attribute of this model. Use this method when changing persistent data (e.g. name and position of nodes).

        Note: It should also be used by the model controller to reset the "modified" attribute after loading a PNML file. Otherwise: The model would be marked as "modified" before the user has modified anything.
        Specified by:
        setModified in interface IModel
        Parameters:
        b - The new state

      • setModified

        public void setModified(boolean b,
                        boolean revalidate)
        Description copied from interface: IDataModel
        Adds parameter "revalidate" to setModified(boolean b) in IModel because not all changes to the model change the structure of the workflow net. (e.g. renaming a node)

        Note: Use this method in the IDataModelController only because some changes in the data model (e.g. firing a transition) must leave the validation unchanged (because validators may reset the marking of the Petri net to the initial marking)!
        Specified by:
        setModified in interface IDataModel
        Parameters:
        b - The new state
        revalidate - Indicates whether the changes require a revalidation of the model.

      • isModelChecked

        public boolean isModelChecked()
        Description copied from interface: IDataModel
        The check state indicates, whether the model needs checking or not. This function indicates the current state
        Specified by:
        isModelChecked in interface IDataModel
        Returns:
        false = model needs checking, true = model already checked

      • setModelChecked

        public void setModelChecked(boolean b,
                            boolean removeInitialCheckState)
        Description copied from interface: IDataModel
        The check state indicates, whether the model needs checking or not. This method will set this state.

        The IDataModelController has to invoke this method whenever changes to this data model change the structure of the Petri net. (Not simple changes like moving or renaming nodes.)

        Parameter "removeInitialCheckState" allows to control which validation will count as "initial validation" since "initial validation" is abort condition for some validators.
        Specified by:
        setModelChecked in interface IDataModel
        Parameters:
        b - new model check state
        removeInitialCheckState - True = remove "initial check" state from the model, false = do not change the "initial check" state

      • isModelValid

        public boolean isModelValid()
        Description copied from interface: IDataModel
        The validity state indicates, whether the model is valid or not. This function indicates the current state. Any changes to the model will set this state to false.
        Specified by:
        isModelValid in interface IDataModel
        Returns:
        false = model is invalid / has errors, true = model is valid

      • setModelValidity

        public void setModelValidity(boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: IDataModel
        The validity state indicates, whether the model is valid or not. This method will set this state.
        Specified by:
        setModelValidity in interface IDataModel
        Parameters:
        b - new model check state

      • addPlace

        public void addPlace(java.lang.String id,
                     EPlaceToken initialTokens,
                     java.awt.Point position)
        Description copied from interface: IModel
        Adds a place to this model.

        Intended use: adding a place after a GUI event when the new place is without a name after creation.
        Specified by:
        addPlace in interface IModel
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the place
        initialTokens - The initial tokens count of the place
        position - The position (center) of the place

      • addPlace

        public void addPlace(java.lang.String id,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     EPlaceToken initialTokens,
                     java.awt.Point position)
        Description copied from interface: IModel
        Adds a place to this model.

        Note: Adds an additional parameter name to the other method addPlace(String id, EPlaceTokens initialTokens, Point position)

        Intended use: adding a place after reading from a PNML file because these places may have a name.
        Specified by:
        addPlace in interface IModel
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the place
        name - The name of the place
        initialTokens - The initial tokens count of the place
        position - The position (center) of the place

      • addArc

        public void addArc(java.lang.String id,
                   java.lang.String sourceId,
                   java.lang.String targetId)
        Description copied from interface: IModel
        Adds an arc to this model.

        Note: This method should be the same for GUI events and reading from a PNML file because arcs will have all 3 attributes in both cases.
        Specified by:
        addArc in interface IModel
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the arc
        sourceId - The id of the source (Place or Transition)
        targetId - The id of the target (Place or Transition)

        private void addElement(IDataElement newElement)
                 throws PNDuplicateAddedException
        Adds the specified IDataElement to this DataModel.
        Parameters:
        newElement - The new element
        Throws:
        PNDuplicateAddedException - If the element already exists

      • addArcToAffectedNodes

        private void addArcToAffectedNodes(DataArc arc)
        Adds the specified DataArc to the predecessor and successor list of the affected nodes!

        Note: A DataArc is specified by the own ID and the IDs of predecessor and successor.
        Parameters:
        arc - The specified arc

      • removeArcFromAllNodes

        private void removeArcFromAllNodes(IDataArc arc)
        Removes the specified DataArc from the predecessor and successor list of all nodes!

        Note: A DataArc is specified by the own ID and the IDs of predecessor and successor.
        Parameters:
        arc - The specified arc
